exercise.label: proteus-travel-time
exercise.p:
The time (T, measured in hours) it takes to drive 50 miles along State Highway 46 depends on the constant speed at which you are driving (s, measured in mph). Since
\text{distance traveled} = \text{speed}\cdot \text{travel time},
T(s) = 50/s.

li.p: Draw a graph of this function and explain why the shape of this graph makes sense.
What is the value of T(60)? Give units on your answer. What does this value mean in context?
Find the average rate of change of T on the interval [60, 65], AV_{[60, 65]}. Give units on your answer.
Does the sign of AV_{[60, 65]} agree with the shape of the graph? make sense? Explain your thinking.
Write a sentence in everyday language explaining the meaning of the value AV_{[60, 65]}. Include units in your sentence.

exercise.label: proteus-wind-turbine
exercise.p:
Wind turbines are used to generate electricity. The power, P, measured in watts, depends on the windspeed, s, measured in mph. For a particular wind turbine,
P(s) = 2.4 s^3.
Find the average rate of change of P on the interval [20, 22], AV_{[20, 22]}, and write a sentence in everyday language explaining the meaning of the value AV_{[20, 22]}. Include units in your sentence.
